1.content:
This was it. This was Samantha's new life for the next few years. No matter how much she had protested and fought her parents, the fact was, she was here now. There was no going back. She didn't think that she'd be able to make it on her own, and her parents had been very clear that they wouldn't support her if she did.

She'd threatened to leave. To cut all ties with them. She'd cried and wept when she realized she couldn't win. None of her friends had been willing to help, willing to take her in. And so, she left. She'd left her old life behind, and made her way to the the ends of the Earth, destined to be forgotten. Or at least that's what it seemed like.

Where once her life had been filled with skyscrapers and concrete, now it held small buildings and forest in every direction. Her old school had held over a thousand students, and now she wasn't sure if there were a thousand people in this lonely village. She was probably exaggerating to herself about the size of the town, but still, the town might as well be empty for all she cared. None of her friends were here. None of the places she knew, or had grown up with. All for what? Because her dad had to get moved here for his work.

It wasn't like he had an important job or anything. He could have easily found a better job. One with prestige. One where she wouldn't be forced to move to this forgotten land. Honestly, she didn't even know what her dad did. He had worked with a pharmacy company, but he had never really talked about what he did. Well, he still worked for them, but now it was in the middle of nowhere.

The sound of a bell ringing caused Samantha to quicken her pace as she made her way up the lonely sidewalk towards a small, brick building with the words Bountiful High School in tarnished copper letters stuck to the front.

She had almost walked right past her new school, unused to something so small. Her last high school had been a massive, state-of-the-art building. This more reminded her of a small medical clinic in the horror movies she loved to watch. She was reminded even more of a horror movie as she made her way through the creaking front door, which echoed in the cold, empty hallways.

Shivering at how cold it was inside, she jumped slightly as the door slammed shut behind her with a loud crack. She glanced around, and let out a sigh of relief that no one had seen her jump. Catching her breath, she glanced around her new school with an obvious look of disappointment.

The floor was nothing more than a plain white tile, that merged seamlessly with matching colored walls. Though the paint was in desperate need of being repainted, and there were obvious cracks in the floor. The puke colored lockers didn't do much to break up how plain the inside of the building was, though she probably should've expected something like this with how run down the outside had appeared.

She pulled out her phone, cursing under her breath as she noticed the time. At her old school she'd always been early to school. She'd been a model student that the teachers loved. Now, she couldn't even show up to class on time. Glancing back and forth, she began searching for her first class, hearing voices coming from many of the closed doors that broke up the rows of lockers. Finally, finding her class, she slowly opened the door, and stepped inside and offered a hasty apology to the plump teacher at the front of the room before taking a seat in one of the empty chairs next to a really overweight boy who looked like he was struggling to reach his desk because of how big he was. The teacher made a brief comment about her being a new student to the class, but she didn't really pay attention to what he was saying.

She did her best to pay attention to what the teacher was talking about, but just couldn't seem to stay focused on the lesson at hand. She let out a sigh of relief as the bell finally rang, dismissing them to go to their next class. She jumped up before anyone else, and quickly went to find her next class. She finally found it just before the bell rang and she took a seat in-between another couple of fat students. The next class went in much the same way as the first. And the third was almost identical to the first two.

Finally, the bell rang for lunch, and she jumped up, rushing past a girl who seemed so fat that Samantha was surprised she could even walk. She was one of the first ones to the lunch room, which surprised her. Usually, there was already a huge line at her old school. Hopefully, they would have good food here. That was one of her complaints about her old school, was that it always seemed like they were serving cardboard. On top of that, they never gave enough food and she always left lunch hungry.

Sam grabbed a tray and moved towards the serving area, where a couple of very large ladies were waiting for her.

"I don't recognize you. You must be the new girl." Said the first lady with a large smile as she heaped a massive portion of potatoes and gravy onto Sam's plate.

"Yeah." Sam mumbled.

The woman chuckled as she loaded a huge portion of roast beef onto Sam's tray, "Oh dearie, there's no need to be shy, we won't bite. If you ever need anything just let us know."

Sam mumbled an okay and finished getting her food, feeling her tray growing noticeably heavier with each item. She couldn't believe how much food was on her tray, and just kept shaking her head as she plopped down at one of the tables in the corner, where she hopefully wouldn't be disturbed.

She watched as the other students began arriving and lining up as she shoveled the delicious food into her eager mouth. She hadn't realized how hungry she'd been, but now that she was eating she couldn't stop herself despite the massive portions. Though, if this was the norm, it was no wonder why almost every kid in line was at least chubby, if not incredibly obese. She really was going to have to be careful or she very well might join them.

She was surprised when she discovered that she'd eaten the entire tray of food, and promised herself that she'd go for a run later that evening. Which reminded her that she still hadn't heard anything about any of the sports teams here. Though, now that she thought about it, she hadn't seen anything advertising any sports. She didn't recall seeing any trophies in any of the display cases, or fliers on the walls. She hadn't even seen a gym since arriving.

She scoffed. The school was probably too small to really warrant any activities like that, though from the look of the other students, it might not be a bad idea. Maybe she would have to talk with the principal about starting up a team or a club. The principal would probably be happy that she was showing some initiative to help the other students. Still, she was the new girl here, so it wasn't like she really knew much about this place yet. Maybe they did have a team. She resolved herself to investigate it further once she was more settled in.

Getting up from the table seemed a little harder after her massive lunch, and she renewed her promise to go running after school so she wouldn't get fat. She tugged on her shorts as they felt like they were cutting into her bloated belly. She couldn't believe how much food she'd eaten. She'd have to tell the lunch ladies to take it easy in the future.

As she was just about to leave the lunch room, she heard someone call her name. She glanced around curiously, and spotted a rather large woman in a billowing dress striding towards her, "Samantha? Samantha Hatchins?"

"Yeah?"

"So nice to meet you!" said the woman with a large smile as she thrust her hand out and gripped Sam's free hand tightly, "I'm Mrs. Vee, the school nurse. If I can just have a moment of your time, it seems like some of your medical information is incomplete and I just need you to come to my office so we can fill in the gaps!"

"Ok." Sam said, feeling like her arm had been yanked out of its socket as Mrs. Vee began practically dragging her down the hallway.

"Now, I hope everything has been going well on your first day. I know we kinda threw you to the wolves, but I hope you've been able to find all your classes and everyone is making you feel welcome. We don't get many knew people in town, most people don't even know this place exists, but you'll find this is a very tight-knit community and we look after each other."

Sam struggled to keep up with Mrs. Vee's rapid speech as she seemed to go into detail about everything about the town before they made it to her office. Her head was spinning as Mrs. Vee half dragged her into a small room that looked like a cozy patients room, complete with a sunflower in a vase by the only bed.

"Have a seat." Mrs. Vee said, gesturing to the bed.

Sam cautiously sat down on the side of the bed, facing Mrs. Vee as she sat down in a large chair and grabbed a clipboard. The next half hour went by rather quickly as Sam was forced to answer question after question about her medical history. Most of the questions were pretty easy, though there were a few that she found a little bit prying.

"Well I think that's all my questions, but before you go, I need to give you a booster shot. It just has some vitamins and other nutrients to make sure you stay healthy."

Sam could hear the light ticking of a clock, as she glanced around the room trying to locate it. She'd already heard the first bell, signaling the end of lunch, which meant she probably had less than five minutes to get her shot and find her class. That really didn't leave a whole lot of time for questions if she wanted to be to class on time.

She bit her lip as she glanced from the door to Mrs. Vee, who was waiting patiently for Sam to respond. Normally she would like to ask more questions about this shot she was about to get, but she really didn't have time, and she was sure that refusing would probably waste more time than the questions. Besides, she had already been late to one of her classes, and she wasn't eager to be known as the girl who was always late.

Sam sighed, nodding her head as she lifted her left sleeve for the nurse.

"This won't hurt a bit," Mrs. Vee said, pulling out a syringe filled with clear liquid.

Sam instinctively looked away as the shot approached. It wasn't like she was afraid of shots, but she was positive that they hurt less if you didn't watch them. Though a moment later, she felt a sharp prick, followed by a burning sensation as the nurse injected her with whatever was in the syringe.

"There, that wasn't so bad." Mrs Vee said, slapping a tan bandage onto the site of the shot.

Sam just shook her head as she grabbed her bag and stood up. She grimaced at the burning sensation in her arm as the weight of her bag made her shoulder feel a bit sore.

Mrs. Vee smiled as she hoisted her large body to her feet and moved to open the door for Sam, letting in the noise of people trying to get to class on time, "Well, you better hurry if you don't want to be late for class."

Sam just nodded before stepping out into the rapidly emptying hallway, still moving her arm as she tried to work out the burning sensation. She glanced over her shoulder as she heard the door close with a loud click behind her, and began making her way towards where she though her class was.

Despite how small the school was, she still got turned around a couple of times, before finding her next class. She hurried in to find everyone already at their seats, and plopped down in an empty chair right as the bell rang. Breathing a sigh of relief, she quickly forgot about the shot as she focused on paying attention in class. As the day went on, though, she found herself growing really hungry despite her large lunch, and by the time she took her seat in her last class it was almost all she could think about.

Her stomach let out a massive growl that was masked by the ringing of the final bell of the day. She blushed slightly, hoping that no one had noticed as she quickly gather her stuff. She was determined to get some food. Though, she probably should work out first, lest she end up like her fellow classmates.

She was almost to the door, when she felt someone tap her shoulder. She turned to see an extremely fat boy standing behind her, looking sheepishly at the ground, while he was obviously blushing.

"I, uh, was wondering if you wanted to maybe grab a bite to eat. I'd be happy to show you around town a little since, you're new. I know a really good buffet, though my mom makes really good food too." the boy stammered, obviously trying to be nice, despite being really nervous.

Sam was rather surprised that this was the first student to talk to her all day. Especially since he seemed like a bit of an outcast, even among his fellow students. Still, despite how large he was, there was a bit of a boyish cuteness to him, and she was sure he'd probably be one of the most handsome students if he lost a couple hundred pounds. On top of that, it wasn't like anyone else had really gone out of their way to befriend her.

111.content:
Sam glanced from the massive boy to the door, then back to the boy who was shifting uncomfortably as he awaited her response. Despite how fat the boy was, there was something about him that she was drawn to. Though it probably helped that she was starving.

"Sure, that sounds nice." she said, smiling as she watched his face light up with glee, "I could definitely go or some food."

"Great! You'll love it!" the boy replied, as he began following her towards the door, "Oh, I'm Stephen, by-the-way."

"Samantha."

Samantha found it hard to walk at the slow pace that Stephen was setting, but it wasn't like she could blame him with how large he was. Though, she was finding herself wondering what it would be like to be as fat as him as they made their way through the small town. Despite how chilly the air was, Stephen seemed to be sweating before too long, though he had plenty of insulation on him to keep him warm. Especially since one of his arms was probably as thick as both her legs together.

Sam shivered, pulling her jacket tighter around herself as she kicked at some leaves on the ground, though she could still hear Stephen's panting over the crumpling of the leaves.

"Yeah, there really isn't too much to this town except a few restaurants and a movie theater. Though, I guess if you like hiking, there are plenty of trails in the forest, though I generally just like to play video games since I don't have anyone to hang out with. Do you like video games?"

Samantha chuckled, "I used to play them a lot, but I guess I ended up on the opposite end as you. None of my friends wanted to play video game, so I ended up on a few of the sports teams. Though it was probably a good thing, since I was pretty chubby when I was a child. Are there any teams at school?"

"Not really. No one really is interested in sports here."

"Really? That's weird."

Now it was Stephen's turn to chuckle, "I don't know if you noticed, but everyone here isn't really what you call athlete material."

"Well maybe if they had a sports team or two, that would change."

"We had one once, but no one would ever sign up for it. Actually, we might still have a team, but you'd probably have to talk to the principal. Though I don't think it would do you much good. Everyone in town is fat."

"Yeah, I noticed. You don't have any health nuts or anything here?"

"Well, it is a pretty small town, but it just ends up that everyone is fat"

"What about people who move here, like me. I'm not fat. Though, the rest of my family probably would fit in pretty well."

"Do you have any siblings?"

"Just a younger sister, she's 14. Then my mom and dad, obviously. Though you didn't really answer my question."

Stephen kicked at a small pile of leaves as he plodded heavily along, "Like I said. Everyone in town is fat. It's just how it is."

"Well, I don't plan on getting fat." Sam said, though part of her wondered if she really meant it.

It was true what she'd said to Stephen, she really had been pretty chubby as a child. Honestly, she hadn't really minded being on the heavier side, but once she started playing sports she'd been able to get in shape pretty quickly. However, even then she hadn't really cared if she was thin or not, it just kind of happened. On top of that, it was hard for her to deny the fact that she was getting aroused thinking about how fat everyone was.

"Here we are." Said Stephen, placing a hand on Sam's shoulder.

They were standing outside a rather large restaurant with brownish brick that made it look pretty plain. Still, the crowd of people was hard to argue with. Sam's stomach let out a rumble as a delicious smell wafted to them on the cool breeze. Drawn almost on instinct, they found a seat and began eating. Sam couldn't believe how hungry she was as she went back for plate after plate of food, all the while talking and laughing with Stephen. There was just something about the delicious food and good company that let her cut loose and eat until she was absolutely stuffed.

She sat back on the bench, looking at the pile of plates on the table, "Whew, I had no idea I could eat so much."

"Yeah, I'm stuffed." Replied Stephen from the other side of the table. She was honestly surprised he could even fit at the booth as he almost took up the entire side to himself. Though, she found her thoughts wandering to what it would be like to be that big.

"So does anyone get so fat they can't leave their house?" Sam suddenly blurted out, though she quickly felt her face go red at being so blunt.

"Honestly, there's probably more people who are immobile than those who aren't. School even has a special program where they take homework to all the kids who can't make it to school because they're so big. I've, uh, actually considered signing up for it a couple of times, though if I had, I wouldn't have met you. Anyway, I guess I should probably let you get going so your family doesn't get worried."

After a few quick goodbyes, Sam began making her way home as Stephen waddled off in the opposite direction. It was definitely easy to see how people could get so fat after the meal that she'd just had. Though it was weird. Despite how full she was, she still wanted to eat more. Though if she wasn't careful, she would probably end up as fat as Stephen. Or fatter. Still, it was an interesting thought....

As she walked, she imagined what it would be like to be so fat she was immobile, and had to have people feed her in bed as she continued to grow and grow and grow. She was still fantasizing about it as she walked into her house and was greeted by a mouth-watering aroma coming from the kitchen.

"Oh, Sam, you're just in time." Her mother said, poking her head out of the dining room, "I made a feast to celebrate you and your sister's first day!"

Sam glanced down at her swollen middle as it let out a growl of anticipation. Dropping her school supplies by the door, she rushed into the dining room where the rest of her family was already seated. She quickly took her seat and began devouring the meal like she hadn't eaten all day, until she finally leaned back in her seat, rubbing her very swollen belly.

She really didn't know what had come over her. Maybe it was just the stress of being in a new place, or maybe she just felt like she didn't have to keep up appearances since she didn't know anyone here really. However, she couldn't deny that part of her was enjoying the feeling of bingeing on all this food.

As she was getting ready for bed, she noticed her sister's door was cracked slightly, and she thought she heard moaning. She creeped towards the door, trying to be careful not to make any noise as she peered into her sister's room. Her eyes went wide as she saw her sister on her bed surrounded by snacks as one hand rubbed her chubby belly.

Her sister had never really seemed to care that she was fat, but this almost looked like she was enjoying it. Still, there was part of Sam that had always been jealous of Heather. She had always been chubby, and she never really seemed to care what other's thought of her. Part of her had always wished that they could switch places, but she'd always been too scared to let herself indulge like her sister.

Sam couldn't help watching her sister stuffing her belly on more snacks despite the large meal she'd just had, and she found herself leaning closer and closer to the crack in the door. Suddenly she lost her balance and fell forward, falling through the open door as her sister let out a small "Eep!"

"What are you doing?" Heather asked, jumping to her feet, which caused her whole body to jiggle.

"I, uh, I noticed the door was open and-"

"So you were spying on me?"

"Well, I, uh, yeah."

Heather shook her head as she sat back down on her bed, "Don't just lay there, close the door."

Sam closed the door behind her, watching her sister intently, "So, um."

Heather grabbed another cookie from a bag beside her, "You're probably wondering what I was doing."

Sam just nodded as she moved to sit on the side of the bed.

Heather sighed, rubbing her flabby belly, "I, um, I like being fat. And I've been so hungry today that I just couldn't help wanting to eat more. I've always wanted to be fatter than everyone else, but it was so hard to gain discretely back in our last city. But here, I don't really stick out. I want to get fatter, but you can't tell mom or dad. Who knows how they'd react. Please don't tell them."

Her sister couldn't keep the pleading tone from her voice with that last part, and she looked at Sam with a look of desperation. She honestly couldn't say she was surprised. Heather always seemed way to comfortable with her fat body, but Sam hadn't realized that she was trying to get fat on purpose. Though was that really much different than what she had been dreaming about all afternoon. If there was ever a place to indulge that fantasy, this was it. Still, she wasn't sure what would happen if she gave into this desire.

Of course the other option was to get her fill by watching her sister blow up like a balloon, and she could probably help that along. She had to admit that she'd always enjoyed her sister's fat body and her sister was admitting that it wasn't going anywhere. Of course she wasn't convinced she was really into this whole fat thing anyway, so maybe she should try to distance herself as much as possible from it.

1111.content:
Sam smiled at her sister, grabbing a cookie from the bag, "Honestly, I was thinking about gaining some weight too. I figure it might be interesting to see what it's like. Though I don't think I'll get as fat as you."

Heather let out a sigh of relief, "I was worried you'd think I was weird or something. Or even worse, tell mom."

Sam grabbed another cookie, "Us sisters have to look out for each other. Especially since we're the new kids on the block."

Heather laid back on her bed, her chubby belly on clear display as she downed another cookie, "That's kind of what I'm thinking. This is a fresh start for us. No time like the present, especially since currently we don't exactly fit in with everyone else."

Sam shoved another cookie into her mouth, "It's definitely weird. Everything here is almost completely opposite from our home. Well, our old home."

Sam took a deep breath as she grabbed another cookie, though she couldn't help noticing the somber look on her sister's face either. It had been hard for both of them to move, and the more they talked about their old home, the more she missed it. And she knew her sister felt the same. Yet, despite the fact that they'd only been here a few days, there was almost a sense of normalcy coming to their lives.

Today was their first day of school, and even though everyone in town was obese, it still felt like school. Their new home was bigger, but it still felt like a home. Even the town felt similar despite having nothing but restaurants and a movie theater. Although, Sam had never really had a place to go hiking, and from what Stephen said, the forest had a bunch of great trails. Not like she'd be able to find anyone to go with her.

After a few more minutes of silence, Sam mentioned the movie theater in town, and the two of them began discussing what sort of movies would be playing in such a small town, and whether they'd be able to keep up on all the series they were used to. Eventually, the discussion changed to what other things they'd like to do in this new town, all while gorging themselves of the snacks Heather had snuck to her room. However, eventually Sam grew tired and decided to go back to her room so she could get some sleep.

Throughout the night, she kept dreaming of getting fatter and fatter. She grew to epic proportions as she ate and ate and ate. And yet, it all seemed so familiar to her, like something that had been with her for a while, and yet she'd forgotten about. She was happy though, happier than she'd been in a long time, and eventually her dreams changed.

She was young, probably 10 or 11, but it was hard to tell. She was in her room playing video games, her chubby belly protruding from her pajamas as she sat on the end of her bed. Morning light was streaming through the large window. Her friends had invited her to go hiking, but she didn't want to go. She just wanted to play video games on her day off. Still, her mother kept saying that was why she was gaining weight, and yet here she was, she was still playing video games, while she gorged herself on snacks. Honestly, she didn't really care. She actually kind of liked her soft belly. Besides, the rest of her family was fat too. Her mother. Her father. Even her sister were all fat. Though it wasn't like her mom really did much to force her to change.

She glanced at her door, which was slightly ajar. She could smell bacon cooking in the kitchen, and her mother singing off key to something on the radio. Despite the snacks she was eating, she was eager for a nice cooked breakfast. She smiled as she caught the sound of her sister snoring in the bed against the other wall, and she glanced over at the chubby girl.

She jumped as a beeping sound filled the air, and she cast her eyes about trying to find the source. Everything was dark, and yet the beeping filled the air. Her eyes bolted open, and she let out a sigh as she turned off her alarm clock. A faint blue glow filled the room, signalling early morning as she rolled out of bed. However, she hadn't even gone 2 steps when her stomach let out a loud growl. She almost doubled over as a huge wave of hunger washed over her.

She moved in front of the stand-mirror in her room, half expecting to see a chubby 10-year-old, and yet, even though she knew the truth, she still felt disappointed as she saw her toned reflection staring back at her. She lifted up her pink shirt, looking at her flat belly in the mirror. She'd almost hoped she'd look fatter after all the food she'd eaten yesterday, but these things took time. Still, it almost seemed like her belly was a little softer than it had been the day before, but that was probably just wishful thinking.

Wordlessly, she started getting ready for the day. After getting showered, she moved to the kitchen where her obese mother was just putting the finishing touches on a large breakfast. She couldn't help notice that even in her family, she was the odd one out. Where she was thin and athletic, the rest of them were definitely borderline huge.

Her mother was probably over 300 pounds, and loved to eat and cook. Which was good since her cooking was so delicious. Her dad was even bigger than her mother, and had always kind of reminded her of a young Santa Claus. Her sister had been one of the fattest girls in her class, though that wasn't too hard considering most of them had been pretty thin. Sam on the other hand, just didn't seem to fit in. That was going to change though. Starting today, she was going to work to put on weight and at least get chubby again.

She ate as much as she could before she had to be leaving for school. However, she still had enough time she could stop and grab some fast food before she had to be to class. Though, just because she wanted to put on weight, didn't mean she had to completely stop exercising. Especially if she wanted to be able to carry her larger body. She had time she could go for a quick run. Finally, she could just go to school and see if she could find Stephen. There were a few things she wanted to ask him about that he'd mentioned the day before.

11111.content:
Despite her large breakfast, Sam couldn't deny that she was definitely still hungry. It was weird though how hungry she'd been lately. She'd never had this big an appetite before coming here. Though, it wasn't like she really had time to think about it if she wanted to grab some food before school.

Finishing getting ready, she stepped out into the cool morning air, as a breeze rustled the few red and orange leaves that were clinging to the trees. Shivering slightly, she sunk deeper into her jacket as she stuck off towards one of the fast food places that were relatively on the way.

As she walked she found herself chuckling slightly. This kind of reminded her of her old home, and how it used to be. Some mornings she'd leave early for school and stop at Henry's Coffee and pick up a doughnut and a hot cocoa on her way to class. Her friends would always tease her that she was going to get fat if she kept having doughnuts for breakfast, though she'd always reply that she was thinner than most of them.

She let out a sigh as she kicked at a stray leaf in her path. It was hard to deny that she still missed her old life. Though, maybe that was why she was so determined to be a different person here. Back home, her friends had always been into the latest fashions or diets. They all wanted to be star athletes, or runway models. But Sam hadn't. She'd been more into video games and computers, but those didn't make people like you. Those didn't stop people from teasing you. Back home, people cared more about how you looked, than who you were. And so Sam had made looks, who she was. But she couldn't deny there had always been something there that made her different.

She continued the rest of the journey, hardly paying attention to what was going on around her mind reminisced on her old life. Even ordering food was just a mindless task to her, though she eagerly began devouring the large quantity of food as she began moving towards her school. All the while, it was feeling like her shirt and jacket were getting tighter around her middle.

Finally arriving at school, she could see a few students still making their way to class. She quickly joined them and made her way inside. Today went by much the same as it did the day before, though she made sure to go back for seconds at lunch, which left her feeling uncomfortably full. Still, it already felt like she was starting to get into a routine. The other change was that she decided to sit by Stephen during the classes they had together, which there were only a couple. He definitely seemed happy to have someone to talk to, and she was happy to have someone making her feel so welcome.

The rest of the week went by in a blur, as she tried to get caught up on her lessons, and adjust to her new life. She found herself spending a lot of time eating as she studied, which was quite frequent given the amount of homework she needed to get caught up on since starting partway through the semester. She didn't really have any time to go jogging or work out either, but it wasn't like she had time to worry about that right now. Still, she was glad when the weekend finally came.

She slowly got out of bed, tugging on her shirt as it rode slightly up her middle. She was still fairly toned, but she couldn't deny that she was starting to seem a bit softer. However, it wasn't really enough for anyone else to tell yet. Now she needed to decide what to do after breakfast.

Still, she wasn't sure what she should do. It was a nice day so she could go hiking. Maybe she could even drag Stephen along with her. Though, he was more likely to want to go get some food or play video games. However, it wasn't like she'd be opposed to either of those. Maybe she could even drag Heather along.

111112.content:
Sam twirled in front of the large mirror in her room, trying to ignore the smells of breakfast wafting from the kitchen. She was starving. Of course that seemed to be her default state lately. She couldn't believe how ravenous she'd been since arriving in Bountiful. Still, it did make it easier to achieve her new goal of putting on some weight. She had to admit, she was liking the results so far. Though, it was barely noticeable.

Her long black hair framed a beautiful face with bright green eyes. Her shirt barely bulged over her chest, reminding her of how much she was lacking in certain areas. The portion sizes were immense, but Heather and Sam were more than up to the challenge.

Sam's hand ran over the mark, a mixture of anxiety and glee filled her as she felt the slight divot in her skin. She couldn't believe she was starting to get a stretch mark. At this rate she would be chubby in just a couple more months.

After almost an hour, she drained the tub and dried herself off, taking one last look at the newly forming stretch mark before putting her clothes back on. Her belly was starting to poke through between her bottoms and shirt, though it still looked really cute.

She'd been to Lydia's house a couple of times since she'd started working at the restaurant, but she wasn't comfortable coming over uninvited just yet. She only had to wait a moment for Lydia to respond, and a few minutes later Sam was making her way out into the cold winter morning.

Sam shivered slightly as the cold wrapped around her, doing its best to sap her heat as she plodded through the fresh powder that had fallen overnight. The trees were bare, and few people were out in the cold, though the ones she did see, seemed almost unaffected by it. Their massive size providing ample insulation from the cold.

Though she'd put on quite a bit of weight the last few months, she was still struggling with the cold. However, she was finding that it wasn't as bad as it used to be as she continued growing her own coat of fat. She'd talked to her mother about getting a car, but she refused to buy one for Sam since she didn't think she'd get to use it very long before she was immobile.

Sam frowned as she walked. It was weird how her mother had done almost a complete 180 in the last month or so. She'd gone from being worried about Sam's weight, to accepting that she was probably going to be immobile at some point. Though she wasn't the only one acting weird. Her dad had seemed almost ecstatic when he'd found out she was pregnant. It seemed like he was always watching her now. Especially when she was eating. He kept insisting on keeping track of her weight. For the babies sake, he would say. Still, she didn't particularly mind.

She turned the corner onto Lydia's street, and walked the last little bit to her house. It was an average sized house, though there were only a couple of vehicles in the driveway. Lydia's mother couldn't go anywhere since she'd become immobile shortly after Lydia was born, though apparently that was quite common for women in this town. Lydia had been freaking out about how fat Sam was going to get now that she was pregnant.

Sam knocked on the door, and waited a minute before it opened, revealing a fat girl, about 8-years-old, "Hey Mia, I'm here to see Lydia."

Mia had a candy bar in one hand, and her shirt was really straining to contain the obese girl, "She's upstairs in her room."

Sam stepped past the girl, jealous of her size, "Is she still playing that game?"

"Yep." Mia said, shutting the door behind Sam.

Sam made her way upstairs, glancing into Lydia's mother's room as she passed. The woman didn't even look like a person anymore with how fat she was. Her body almost completely filled the room, carpeting it in her soft fleshy belly. Sam couldn't deny that a part of her wanted to be that big. She wanted to be so fat, that she could fill a whole house with her body. With a sigh, she tore her gaze away and walked into Lydia's room.

"Hey."

"Hey! How's the mother to be? You really are starting to get big." Lydia said, pausing the game she was playing.

"You're one to talk. I don't even think you fit in that chair anymore."

Lydia was definitely getting huge. She was camped out in a large armchair, though her belly was starting to flow over the sides. Numerous snacks and wrappers surrounded her, and she was using her belly as a table for what looked like a meal for 10 people. Her bra was straining to contain her large chest, and her belly was so big that Sam wasn't even sure if she was wearing underwear of not.

"Yeah, you say that now, but I bet you'll end up bigger than me soon. Getting pregnant here changes you. Makes you super hungry all the time and you just end up blowing up like a balloon."

"Well, you seem to be gaining faster than me. So are you pregnant?"

Lydia bit her lip, "No, but I've definitely had help."

"What's that supposed to mean?" Sam said, plopping down on the wooden chair at Lydia's desk.

Lydia glanced out her door, lowering her voice to a whisper, "Honestly, I actually tried this new experimental drug that was supposed to help me gain some weight. Though I haven't been able to stop since I took it. There was this girl in the restaurant one day, and she was eating a ton. More than I could've imagined. So I asked her about her big appetite, and she said her dad worked for the lab that's here in town and she'd found this drug in his briefcase. Said that there were some notes with it on how it could help people gain a lot of weight and still be healthy, so she took some of them and she said she'd been hungry ever since. She just couldn't get full, and she said that it had made it really easy to pack on the weight.

"So, I asked if she had anymore and she gave me a few. This is the result of taking one of them. I've been so hungry all the time, and sure enough, I've been able to pack on the pounds really easy. Too easy actually. I was hoping to at least be on par with some of my friends, but now I don't think I can stop."

"Really? Is something like that even possible?"

"You tell me. If you want, I could give you the rest. Though, I think being pregnant will give you enough of a boost if you're looking to gain weight."

"How many do you have?"

"Three. I don't want them anymore, but I didn't want to throw them away. They're yours if you want them."
